==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=瘪三|gloss=-|alt=必三}}

===Etymology===
{{bor|zh|en|[[beg]] [[sir]]}}.

Originally used in Shanghainese, to refer to people who stole food from houses in the [[w:Shanghai International Settlement|British Concession of Shanghai]]. Popularised by literary works in the early 20th century. Later spread to other Chinese varieties.
